Fields.DialogueText: Boiky? Boiky!
Where could she have gotten to...
... Zzz... kagda my byli na vaynye... tam kazhdy dumal a svayey... zzz...
Oh, for goodness' sake. Boiky!
Aaah! Socialism in one country!
You've been snacking and sleeping again. What do you think you're doing?
What do you mean, what do I... oh, hello, Kapitan! What brings you down to the boilers?

Fields.MenuText: I could ask you the same question.
Never mind that. We've got trouble.
I've a mind to report your dereliction of duty to Zurich.

Fields.DialogueText: Chert voz'mi! I should be thankful I didn't fall asleep in one of the torpedo tubes again.
Why didn't you say so? Sleep is for the dead and the bourgeoisie!
Understandable, Kapitan. I'd do it myself if I didn't have more important things to worry about!
But I think you may sing a different tune once you find out what I've been working on!
Make it quick. We need to form up and drive off these Morganas.
No konechno! Now first ask yourself, Kapitan - wait, did you say Morganas?
Did I stutter?
You may want to start. It reminds me of gunfire! K oruzhiyu!
Action stations, then. And get rid of that chocolate.
Da!
@BATTLE
Mmm...
Something bothering you?
Do you smell that, Kapitan?

Fields.MenuText: What am I looking for? Or... smelling for?
Sea salt and gunsmoke?
I thought you just ate?

Fields.DialogueText: A target, if you're doing this right!
Da, but not quite. Be like a mole and dig deeper with your nose!
Hunger is a struggle with no permanent solutions.
Now, think outside your head and feel the scent.
You couldn't possibly be making less sense right now.
Radi boga! Look over there at those Morganas.
What!? Why didn't you just say so?
@BATTLE
We need to talk about your recklessness, Boiky. Those Morganas were almost on top of us before you let us know.
Vse chast' plana!
All part of what plan, exactly?
Surely you humans have felt crushing despair when the Rusalki are near?
It's fear. We work through it.
Fear is just an object. Rusalki wear it like an ugly sweater. I wanted to teach you to sense it early. By the time a coward sees Morganas, it is too late already.
Are you calling me a coward?
Only if you do not trade fear for excitement! You cannot feel the thrill of impending doom with just your eyes.
Most of the crew don't find doom thrilling.
All the more reason to swim through it like cold spring snowmelt!
I think we'll have to agree to disagree.
Do not worry, Kapitan! You will see the funny side in time.
You've been pacing around the deck like that all day. Is something wrong?
Nichego, Kapitan! I'm practicing my morale lecture for the crew.

Fields.MenuText: That could be helpful. It's nice to know that your Belle's rooting for you.
"Morale lecture?" Do those words really go together?
You'd be the right person to give one. You never seem to slow down.

Fields.DialogueText: Spasibo! Would you like to hear a sample?
I would tell you to ask that master orator Lenin, but he's no longer with us. Perhaps he will listen to an excerpt!
If a shark stops swimming, it dies! So it is with me. Allow me to show you my progress!
Go ahead, I'd love to hear it.
Ahem... "Shall we cower at some underdressed fairy tale? Perish the thought! Let her tell stories of us around the fires! Let us write ghost stories that pale next to our savagery!"
Powerful stuff. That ought to rile the crew up.
"And should any among the crew doubt our bloodlust, he will be set upon and torn to pieces by his mates, that they would put his flesh and bone to better use!"
Um...
Ne tak li? Ooh, there's a pack of Rusalka to try our guns on now!
Action stations.
... And work on that lecture.
@BATTLE
Boiky, what was it you wanted to show me? And why in the boiler room?
An American Belle told me a story one day, Kapitan. The pirate Blackbeard filled his ship's hold full of hot coals to create a hell of his own.
Hence your decision to hold weapon maintenance classes here.
I figured it was the next best thing!

Fields.MenuText: I suppose a little test of endurance can't hurt.
If the crew can survive you, they can survive the Morganas.
What exactly is your endgame here?

Fields.DialogueText: As a start. Heh heh heh...
Revolution begins in the body and the spirit. Today, hot and confined spaces. Tomorrow, the world!
Mankind united in its overthrow of the bourgeoisie. They sweat for no master but the common good!
That's one way to get them to learn, I suppose.
Indeed! But I'm in a benevolent mood, so there is a prize for the fastest field strip and reassembly. Care for a chocolate-covered zefir?
Delicious! The crew will love these.
Indeed! I always-- one moment, Kapitan.
Is that a slingshot?
Vy tam! Eyes down, sailor!
Boiky, what on earth are you doing down here with mines!?
Ne volnuytes, Kapitan! These are not the armed ones.
The armed ones?
Vnimaniye! I sense Morganas. To your positions!
Now, *she* will get the armed ones...
@BATTLE
What are those books you've got there? You never struck me as much of a reader.
You are a dutiful kapitan, so there has been no reason to strike you!
I... what? That's not what I...
Enough dithering. Read!
The Declaration of the Rights of Man, a Bible... Pride and Prejudice?
With some annotations of my own.

Fields.MenuText: It looks like you've just scribbled out the authors' names and replaced them with yours.
Boiky, I don't have time for this, and odds are neither do you.
What do you mean "annotations"? Is this what you've been working on?

Fields.DialogueText: Figuratively speaking, everyone does that when they discuss books. I simply do not pretend to interpret!
That is because you keep to a regular sleep schedule!
Among many other things, Kapitan. It pays to keep occupied!
"It is a truth universally acknowledged that a Morgana in possession of an intact hull must be in want of holes in it." I'm... not following.
Why are you humans so afraid of the Morganas, Kapitan? Because you have never seen them before. Your history must be repurposed for survival! The crew will love it.
I'm not sure propaganda alone will save us.
Nyet. That is what the guns are for!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Boiky, thank goodness you're on deck. The crew are reporting a fire on...
Da! I am glad you got your invitation.
Invitation to what?
The bonfire, of course!
Put it out at once! You're a Belle. You should know better.
Why do you think I built it? Look closely at the fuel.
Are you... burning books?
Do not worry, Kapitan. They are mine.
The propaganda pieces? But you just distributed them to the crew.
And they distributed them back. I asked for nonessentials for a fire, and this was the result!

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry to hear that. I know you were only trying to help.
You couldn't get rid of them more safely?
You seem oddly chipper about it.

Fields.DialogueText: Ya tsenyu eto, but it is nothing to fret about. I will simply try again!
I must make a statement somehow. What better way than to burn my failure in effigy?
Fire does not delight you? How strange.
I'm going to insist that you put it out. We don't need to help the Morganas build fires.
And create a smokescreen for the approaching terrors? Kapitan, you are a genius!
If you say so...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Kapitan, are all our enemies simply in hiding today?
Sometimes patrols come up empty.
Eto ad. No Rusalki in sight, calm seas... it is too quiet for a destroyer like me!
Most of the men disagree. It's not every day we get some peace and quiet.
Perhaps this is their plan all along. To bore me to death.
Not even Morganas would be that cruel.
Wouldn't they, Kapitan? Isn't this just like them? To strike at your deepest desires and dearest wishes?
Isn't your dearest wish a global socialist utopia?
Kapitan, you may be right! What if these Rusalki are fascists in disguise, scheming at every turn to crush the revolution?

Fields.MenuText: You're just being paranoid. Morganas don't have fascism.
Beats me. Ask one of the German Belles if they think so.
Unless one of them goes into politics, I doubt it.

Fields.DialogueText: Not yet, maybe. But that's exactly the kind of lie a fascist would want to spread!
Ha! You might as well mediate peace talks between squids and whales!
What is the political arena if not another battlefield?
Curse those sea witches! They will rue the day they tried to bore the revolution out of Boiky! I'll show them. I'll blow up islands to entertain myself, and they'll be powerless to...
Wait! I can sense one now! Isn't it a relief, Kapitan!
It scares me that I agree with you.
@BATTLE
Hello down there, Kapitan!
What are you doing up on the flagpole?
Fighting my boredom tooth and nail!
Should I be worried?
Only if you are a Morgana! Are you a Morgana, Kapitan?
Not the last time I checked. What exactly are you up to?
I was thinking about our fascist Rusalki just the other day.
I told you - the Morganas aren't secret fascists.
That we know of. That is why they are secret!
... Go on.
What causes boredom, Kapitan?
Having nothing to do, I suppose.
Ty prav! But I cannot help but poke at everything I see. I think if I am bored, I am simply not seeing enough things. Hence my perch!
What do you see?
A German spotter plane! Watch this...
Boiky, that's an ally! Don't launch that--
Ne volnuytes'! That mine is just a dud.
*BOOM*
A dud?
Nyet, I suppose it was armed after all. I cannot decide if I am relieved about missing that fascist.

Fields.MenuText: You're lucky you did. Zurich would have had words.
Don't worry. Nobody else will ever down a plane with a slingshot.
The Germans are our allies at sea.

Fields.DialogueText: I have words too! They all end in "Bang!"
That is why no one will ever have as much fun as me!
Your war may have been set aside, but the revolution never sleeps.
There are Morganas for you to shoot at. I'll give you this, Boiky.
Then I have succeeded again!
@BATTLE
Kapitan, I think you are too tense.
This from the Belle who fires on our allies for fun.
With a slingshot!
That you use to shoot mines.
Unarmed ones!
Really?
Most of the time.
I think we understand each other now.
One day you will love the fires of war as I do, Kapitan. I cannot help but burst with the unstoppable tide of change! Don't you feel it all around you?
That's probably got more to do with your constant snacking.
Would you calm down if I offered you one of my Turkish delights?

Fields.MenuText: It actually might, come to think of it.
You're missing the point. Allies are not targets.
Where do you even get all your sweets?

Fields.DialogueText: They always help me! I can't keep up my pace without them.
Even the fascist ones?
There's this French submarine I buy from, but I'm not supposed to tell you her name.
How about this - no friendly fire or sweets?
Kapitan! You wouldn't!
Don't tell me what I would or wouldn't do.
No... sweets... Morganas! You face the fury of a dying star!
Oh, for heaven's sake.
@BATTLE
I have made a decision, Kapitan!
Uh-oh.
I have decided... that the Morganas may not be secret fascists after all.
You woke me up at this hour to tell me what I've been trying to tell you all this time?
The revolution does not respect the schedules of the old world, and neither do the Morganas!
So what are they, if they're not secret fascists?
First understand that where there is fascism, there is communism to fight it. Bourgeois violence, bigotry, and division - these are the last gasps of their state as the united proletariat rise to--
Get to the point.
Fear, Kapitan! The Morganas attack fascist, capitalist, communist, irrespective of ideology. It is not communism alone they hate - it is the essential human desire for unity!
Which communism just happens to embody.
Yestestvenno! Naturally.
That still doesn't tell me why you've woken me up.
I needed to steel you for the impending battle!
Steel faster.
@BATTLE
Boiky, where are you going!?
Do not restrain me, Kapitan! My guns alone do not speak loud enough!
I couldn't if I tried...
@BATTLE
Did you see that, Kapitan? Chto zh?
I won't deny that you did a number on them.
I did a whole abacus on those filthy Rusalki!
You did... right, I get it. As well as on our surroundings. There used to be an island there, you know.
"The Communists disdain to conceal their views and aims!" You've read the Manifesto, I trust.

Fields.MenuText: I've been meaning to.
Don't change the subject.
Yes, but that doesn't excuse your actions today.

Fields.DialogueText: I will lend you my copy, Kapitan! I've memorized it already.
But I have not! Everything is related in a way you will soon understand.
Leave that to history.
We're going to be under some serious scrutiny if you can't restrain your trigger finger.
But Kapitan... slingshots do not have triggers.
*Stop blowing up islands.*
Even if it helps?
Especially if it "helps."
What in the world are we shooting at?
The Rusalki, Kapitan! They're all around!
And what are you shooting at?
The Rusalki, of course!
I suppose that school of flying fish just happened to be in the way.
Pay attention to where they fell, and the crew will eat well tonight!
@BATTLE
I do not understand, Kapitan. How can you fight without making a mess?
You're making a mess of sea creatures, our materiel, and rocks. Not even the Morganas are this bad about friendly fire.
This is revolution! The world may be scarred and bruised, but we may simply rebuild it bigger and better. Belles and humans, working together for a common good... that does not excite you?

Fields.MenuText: Not when you're causing so much collateral damage. This ends now.
I know you're only trying to help, but you're doing more harm than good.
I have to live in the world, you know.

Fields.DialogueText: What if I promised to fix it?
You're thinking short term, Kapitan. Imagine what the rebuilding will accomplish!
Then surely you understand it is imperfect!
I'm cutting you off. No more snacks until you can leave things in better shape than you found them in.
But... Kapitan...
Nyet, nyet, nyet, nyet...
Eshelon za eshelonom... zzz... eshelon za eshelonom...
Boiky, wake up! We've got Morganas!
Boiky!
... ZzzAAAhhh! The history of all hitherto existing society is the history of class struggles!
I've read it too. Get out there.
@BATTLE
Ugh... am I still dreaming?

Fields.MenuText: You fought those Morganas just fine, didn't you?
Yes. Go back to sleep.
No, you're not. What were you doing asleep at this hour?

Fields.DialogueText: I... suppose so? I'm not used to being so... *yawn*...
The Rusalki do not sleep, and neither should... *yawn*...
I'm usually wide awake now... and at all other times... *yawn*
Perhaps if I had my stash of sugar I'd be more... awake.
Are you pulling my leg?
You could say I'm the only vehicle that runs better with sugar in the gas tank!
All right. The experiment's over. Tell that French submarine you're no longer cut off. But I reserve the right to recommend reassignment to the South Georgia Islands.
You won't regret it, Kapitan!
There, Kapitan! Do you see them?
Clear as day. Are you ready?
Okolo, Kapitan. I just need to fire myself up a bit...
What do you mean, "fire yourself up?"
I've been saving some of these for a rainy day! Chocolate-covered prune?

Fields.MenuText: I'll pass.
Maybe just one.
All these sweets can't be good for you.

Fields.DialogueText: Suit yourself. Just a handful of these and I'll laugh off their feeble fire!
There is no such thing as "just one!" How do you do it?
Actually, the opposite is true! Without these sweets to give me energy I drop like a rock.
I can't believe junk food does this to you. You have to be faking.
Ever read that one American comic, Kapitan? About the sailor who eats spinach to be strong?
Once or twice.
Think of it that way.
How does that...
But don't think about it too hard. Dlya revolyutsii!
@BATTLE
Boiky, I wonder if...
No time, Kapitan! These decks will not swab themselves!
We have the crew for that, you know.
Da, da, da, but I am the best equipped for this. My strength is boundless!
Except when you pass out.
Extraordinary accomplishments demand extraordinary recovery.

Fields.MenuText: Just as long as you don't decide to recover in the middle of a fight.
I've never heard of another Belle sleeping the way you do.
I can't help but wonder if this isn't another excuse to get what you want.

Fields.DialogueText: I would sooner explode than slow down. At least that way I would take some Rusalki with me!
You have never heard of another Belle like me, Kapitan! Nor will you ever, unless my sisters join the glorious battle.
Excuses are for wreckers and opportunists!
What are you even cleaning for? Our maintenance schedule states...
No schedule survives contact with the enemy!
Or with a determined ally.
Once all the pieces are in place, you will know. But first-- Chert! They come.
You know what to do.
Gryaznyye ved'ma! I just finished buffing that!
@BATTLE
Kapitan, will you please hold this for me?
Of course not!
Well, who knew! I thought a kapitan would take more of an interest in the ship's maintenance.
Boiky, that gun barrel is bigger than I am!
It is, nyet? I sometimes forget human limitations. Ne vazhno. I can do this one-handed... but one day you will as well!

Fields.MenuText: Thank you... I think?
You're either blind or optimistic. Maybe both.
We're human. We'll work around it.

Fields.DialogueText: Vsegda! You'll find a way.
If part of me fails, my other senses will make up the difference. So it is for the revolution!
Zakhvatyvayushche! I would never be satisfied letting a machine do the heavy lifting!
You've finished cleaning, I take it?
I got the difficult spots and left the rest to the crew. You haven't noticed my wonderful glow?
I haven't been able to walk outside without sunglasses.
Excellent! That means it is working. In the meantime, I repair my guns.
I was going to ask about that. You make your fire count, but can't sustain it.
It's these silly B-13s, Kapitan! Barrel pressure being what it is, I can't even empty the magazine without replacing the damned thing.
That's inexcusable. A rush job if I ever heard of one.
The next Five-Year Plan will fix it. Why do you think I use a slingshot half the time?
Thank goodness for that. That Morgana seems to have noticed that you're busy.
Otlichno! The most dangerous predators appear to be prey...
@BATTLE
... Zzz... Vstavay, proklyat′yem zakleymyonny... zzz...
Boiky! On your feet!
... Zzz... the free development of each is the condition for the free development of all! I'm up!
Hello.
Chert, chert, chert... where was I?
Asleep on the barrel of a B-13, by the look of it.
Gah! What if we'd been attacked!?
I wouldn't have worried. You're invulnerable, aren't you?
Yes, but my uniform would have been ruined! Do you have any idea how hot these things get? And how much food I keep in my pockets?
Yes... and no.
Oh! Speaking of, you simply must try this gingerbread. Tula makes splendid...
I'd rather know how your repairs are coming along. Are they really so extensive?
I was based on Italian designs, you know. Say what you will about those fascists -  they know how to get a project out the door. Warts and all.
You seem like you have the guns under control.
My 21-Ks are hand-loaded. Hand-loaded! And without a time fuze they're only good for direct hits...

Fields.MenuText: I could see what Zurich can spare.
For a ship with chronic equipment malfunctions, you're a terror in battle.
Not to offend you, but how in the world did that pass muster?

Fields.DialogueText: No need, Kapitan, but I appreciate it. The best weapons are forged in battle!
We make the best of what we are issued. Resourcefulness means pleasant surprises!
The second Five-Year Plan demanded destroyers, and that is what the Motherland got.
But we can talk about my shortcomings later. For now we will pretend they do not exist! The Morganas do not have to know...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Chert! Fascist thing!
Is that B-13 still acting up?
No matter how much I lecture it, it still will not fire as I tell it to!

Fields.MenuText: Maybe you're not berating it enough.
Words don't work on guns.
My offer to talk to Zurich still stands.

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe I'm not turning enough of my other guns on it!
You would be surprised what the right invective in the right place can do!
It may sit down, Kapitan!
What if you can't fix it?
Unfortunately, you may be right. If my math is correct, the rifling isn't deep enough on these things. And that is not something I can fix here.
That has to be frustrating.
Do you ever wake up in the morning and your neck hurts, and there's nothing you can do about it?
I think I see what you mean.
On the bright side, my other projects are coming along splendidly!
What other projects?
The hull has never been shinier, and I've had the crew bring on some searchlights they found in port!
Are you making repairs or putting on a burlesque?
Ooh, that might be fun! We have space for a stage in the galley, don't we?
Forget I said anything. Please.
Heads up! Morganas approaching, Boiky.
@BATTLE
Khorosho! Watch and learn, Kapitan - this is where all my planning comes together!
I'm familiar with the searchlight and the hull. Explain the mirrors to me.
They just arrived today! The centerpiece of my secret weapon, I daresay.
Do they have anything to do with the crew all wearing sunglasses?
Vse. Everything.
I'll take your word for it.
No need! The Rusalki rear their ugly reactionary heads now. Will you do the honor of flipping the switch?
Of course.
And Kapitan... put these sunglasses on. You will need them.
@BATTLE
I see what you meant about the sunglasses.
Ha! Did you see those witches cower before us? They were blinded by the light of a new world! You cannot shoot straight while staring into the sun!

Fields.MenuText: I really didn't expect that to have an effect, but well done!
New world or not, it certainly was bright.
We aren't going to do that every time, are we?

Fields.DialogueText: Spasibo! Now we celebrate our ingenuity!
And it would never have come about without our crew's diligence! We will have songs sung about this day.
Oh, konechno nyet. There is no winning an arms race!
What gave you the idea, exactly?
Simple, Kapitan. We Belles are nearly invulnerable, nyet? But that doesn't mean we can't be inconvenienced. The Rusalki are no different.
So you couldn't shoot straight if you couldn't see.
Haven't you noticed us cruising more slowly when I sleep? It is why I hate to sleep.
I've been meaning to ask you about that.
One day, Kapitan. For now, we toast to our brilliance!
Trying to start another bonfire?
Da... I've been at this for hours with the lights and mirrors.
What is the kindling point of steel?

Fields.MenuText: Not something I want you finding out at sea.
Hotter than you can achieve with lights and mirrors.
Do the Morganas even use steel?

Fields.DialogueText: Ne volnuytes'! I can fix just about anything with time and some scrap metal.
You are probably right, but I am having too much fun to admit it just yet!
They must, mustn't they?
Our little experiment with the mirrors proved it, Kapitan. The Rusalki are no less mortal than I am.
Aren't you practically immortal?
Nyet. Not forever, I won't be!
That doesn't make sense.
It doesn't have to. What I mean is that if our enemy were really so powerful, they would not settle for emulating us. Think of the fascists, Kapitan.
Another of your political lectures?
Just hear me out! To capitalists, both Germany and Russia look terrifying. But one imposes unity from the top down, while the other foments it in the people. Ask any of the Soviet Belles!
So what does that have to do with the Morganas?
They destroy without creating. Even their best weapons are stolen from their enemies. Thus...
I think I see what you're getting at. They talk a big game, but they're just as vulnerable as you are.
More or less. But they have no sense of community!
Here's your chance to enlighten some of them.
The experiments will have to wait. Privyet, Rusalka, you bourgeoisie in scary clothes!
@BATTLE
Rusalki spotted, Kapitan! You'll need your binoculars for those ones!
What am I looking at?
Tam! Do you see them on the bow? Playing plaintive and sad, like poor actresses?
Are those... sunglasses?
It seems our lesson was well learned! I suspected our little mirror trick would only work once.

Fields.MenuText: That's interesting, but I don't see how it changes the rules of engagement.
So that whole project was for nothing?
Now I'm intrigued. What else could we make them do?

Fields.DialogueText: It doesn't really, but it proves a point I wanted to make to the crew!
Oh, Kapitan, it was for everything!
Now you are thinking like someone I would call comrade!
It's perfect fodder for a lecture! You remember my old one?
The one where you said the crew would tear each other to pieces?
I removed that bit and you know it!
You were saying...
The Rusalki are plagiarists who try to do the things we do and better. But that just means we are the ones who steer the course of their evolution!
That's not a bad way of putting it. You'd encourage the crew to persevere and be creative.
And when the Rusalki are done, the same lesson can be applied to fascists when I bring the crew around to the revolution!
Let's focus on the Morganas for now. The revolution will wait.
Ha! That's what the Romanovs said...
@BATTLE
Matrosy! Our enemy prowls the waves, ever searching to tear down that which she spuriously copies. But today she will know the fury of the genuine article!
Well said. I've never seen the crew so excited for a fight.
Ya znayu! But I cannot take all the credit, Kapitan. It is their own lust for victory that leads them to take heart in my words!
That's really selfless of you, Boiky.
More importantly, it is true! That fighting spirit lives in all of us, just waiting to be awakened.
Sort of like you Belles and our ships.
Da, a little bit! But even my words can only do so much.

Fields.MenuText: You've been up to something else, haven't you?

Fields.DialogueText: I was only up all last night cooking! Have some charlotte, Kapitan, it does no good in my pockets!
Delicious! I take it the crew have had some already.
One bite of my charlotte could wake the dead!
And put some ghost ships to rest. Have at it, Boiky.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: They do a lot.
Words can inspire, but it always takes violence to settle the matter.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not afraid to fight, Kapitan. Or do other things...

Fields.MenuText: Some people inspire as examples of action. No words required.

Fields.DialogueText: I have more than words, Kapitan...
Spasibo, Kapitan! But there is more...
Kapitan, look at this.
A sniper rifle? Are you finally upgrading from that slingshot?
Nyet! Not on your life. It's an older Mosin-Nagant. One of the other Soviet Belles sent this to me as a joke.
I'm not seeing the funny side.
Look at the sights, Kapitan! The distances are still measured in arshins. Arshins!
We've been on the metric system for decades, and still these are seeing use in our armies!

Fields.MenuText: If only tanks had Belles to whip things into shape on land.
Change doesn't always happen as quickly as it needs to.
What do you expect to do about it? The INPF doesn't have a say in the land war.

Fields.DialogueText: If only...
You've seen the state of my guns. I don't know when we'll get replacements in!
Then we will just have to lead by example.
There's nothing we can't work around with the right attitude, Kapitan. But we could do more if the weapon manufacturers would just... talk to each other! To the soldiers!
You're the Belle. Guns are a part of you in a way they've never been for anyone else. If I were you, I'd start writing letters.
Good thing I already don't sleep, right, Kapitan? I've got a whole army to refurbish... and more Rusalki to fight.
@BATTLE
That's the longest I've seen you stay in one place. Are you rewriting history again?
Sometimes I wish I could, Kapitan.
What are these? Design specifications? That must be dense reading.
Meet my sisters... or my sisters yet to be. Retivyy, Razyaryonnyy, Rezkiy... most of them are due in service within a year.
Despite the construction flaws.
I'll have twenty-nine sisters when all is said and done. Did you know I was meant to have forty-seven?

Fields.MenuText: Family reunions must be noisy.
I'm surprised they ordered that many, what with their problems.
They never counted on you.

Fields.DialogueText: Heh. One day when this is all over, you will be more than welcome to one.
War was coming. We work with the tools we have.
Nyet, they did not. I wonder if they will.
If I were in charge I would have rushed them all out. Everyone should have a place in this new world we're building. And yet... we can't sit and wait for the right tools.
It's like you keep saying - we have to make the best of a bad situation.
Dlya revolyutsii. But, Kapitan...
Boiky.
Is it possible to miss someone you've never met?
If you feel it is, then it is. But what would they say if they saw you now?
They'd tell me to stop reading about them, get out there, and make a case for them to be built! Wouldn't they, Kapitan?
Trust a Belle to go looking for a fight.
We've found one! Shall we go win it?
@BATTLE
That's odd... Boiky?
... zzz... Pust on zemliu berezhet rodnuiu... zzz... A liubov Katyusha sberezhet...
Predictable. Boiky, get up!
... zzz... True conformity is possible only in the cemetery! ... Oh, dobryy den', Kapitan.
What's all this? You're taking up a whole table by yourself.
The galley was empty, so I thought I'd sketch out everything I wanted to get done in the coming weeks. That was... Chert, what day is it?!
So that's why the crew weren't eating in here. Looks like you were, though.
I've never run out of snacks before! We'll have to write to Command at once!
I was going to talk to you about Command anyway. They told me you had a cruising range of...
4,890 kilometers, sir, at just a kusochek under twenty knots!
So why do we have you refueling so often? You've rarely broken 4,200.
Could be the fuel the Motherland gives me. It never was very efficient.
That shouldn't be a problem. The INPF lend-lease gives all participants access to the higher quality...
Let me see those papers, Kapitan... Ah! Just as I thought!
I keep close track of my personal effects. The bigger my snack stash, the shorter my range!
You're not seriously telling me that your cruising range is because of poor nutrition.
Other things being equal, what else could it be?
But that's... Belles don't... how?
As I said, don't think about it too hard. Now are we going to talk about my diet, or are we going to eat us some Rusalki?
Good grief.

Fields.MenuText: That girl is going to be the death of me. But hopefully, she'll be the death of the Morganas first.
Spending time with Boiky, well... it's kind of exhilarating.

Fields.DialogueText: Morgana forces spotted. Boiky, get the crew to battle stations!
Aye aye, Kapitan!
@BATTLE
